content.body: wait I thought it did have a static module record?

content.body: The mini-maps are interesting because they contain subgraphs, some of which are potentially cyclic.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: The mini-maps are interesting because they contain subgraphs, some of which are potentially cyclic.

content.body: Thankfully you can arrive at a deterministic ordering of the subgraphs by sampling in order of appearance in the source.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Thankfully you can arrive at a deterministic ordering of the subgraphs by sampling in order of appearance in the source.

content.body: well, presumably we'd do this ordering with the same algorithm we use for normal cyclic graphs (depending on where you start with in the cycle)
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: well, presumably we'd do this ordering with the same algorithm we use for normal cyclic graphs (depending on where you start with in the cycle)

content.body: Yeah, maybe. There might be optimizations that are possible only if the entrypoint doesn’t figure. But that doesn’t surface to JavaScript regardless.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Yeah, maybe. There might be optimizations that are possible only if the entrypoint doesn’t figure. But that doesn’t surface to JavaScript regardless.

content.body: StaticModuleRecords would hang off the nodes of the mini-graph, not off the ModuleBlock.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: StaticModuleRecords would hang off the nodes of the mini-graph, not off the ModuleBlock.

content.body: huh, that's a way to represent it, I guess more normalized and less cyclic of a structure than I was imagining
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: huh, that's a way to represent it, I guess more normalized and less cyclic of a structure than I was imagining

content.body: They don’t correspond to a document per se. Not something you could fetch.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: They don’t correspond to a document per se. Not something you could fetch.

content.body: Except perhaps in a compiled form.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: Except perhaps in a compiled form.

content.body: One of the interesting things about lexical linkage is that the compiler can erase the names.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: One of the interesting things about lexical linkage is that the compiler can erase the names.

content.formatted_body:
BTW note that the mini-graph is actually something like a singly linked list of maps, following a scope chain, as you could have (and this is stupid code but still possible),

module foo { }
module bar { }
if (true) {
  module foo { }
  module baz { }
  module bing { import foo; import bar; }
}

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
BTW note that the mini-graph is actually something like a singly linked list of maps, following a scope chain, as you could have (and this is stupid code but still possible),

module bar { }
if (true) {
  module foo { }
  module baz { }
  module bing { import foo; import bar; }
}
